snippet: The European Commission asserts that the software giant breached commitments made in 2009 to open the browser market.
abstract: European Commission says that it is beginning new antitrust proceedings against Microsoft, saying the company failed to live up to a three-year-old agreement to give users of its Windows software better access to competitors' Internet browsers; software giant could face substantial fines for breaching the European Union's antitrust rules.
lead_paragraph: The European Commission asserts that the software giant breached commitments made in 2009 to open the browser market.

headline.print_headline: Microsoft Faces a New Antitrust Action and Fines in Europe
